details.title: Impact of landfall started, says Met department
details.content: The impact of landfall process has started. Fani will make a landfall between 8-11 am, says HR Biswas, Director, Met Dept, Bhubaneswar:

details.title: More than 1 million people evacuated from Odisha's vulnerable districts
details.content:
Odisha: People take refuge in a shelter in Paradip of Jagatsinghpur. Over 1 million people have been evacuated from vulnerable districts in last 24 hrs & about 5000 kitchens are operating to serve people in shelters. #CycloneFani is expected to make a landfall in Puri dist today. pic.twitter.com/Hp3oXhkPSB

— ANI (@ANI) May 3, 2019

details.title: Great danger signals hosted at Andhra Pradesh ports
details.content: Great danger signal no. 10 hoisted at Kalingapatnam, Bheemunipatnam ports. Great danger signal no. 8 hoisted at Visakhapatnam and Gangavaram ports. (ANI)

details.title: More trains cancelled
details.content:
East Coast Railway: It has further been decided to cancel 10 more trains - 7 trains on 3rd May, one train on 4th May, one train on 6th May & one train on 7th May. Railways had earlier cancelled 147 trains from 1st to 3rd May. #CyclonicStormFANI pic.twitter.com/uuTAseYHLr

— ANI (@ANI) May 3, 2019

details.title: Landfall process started at 8 AM, says IMD
details.content:
ESCS FANI about 25 km SSWof Puri at 0830 IST. To cross Odisha coast between Gopalpur & Chandbali close to Puri during 0800-1100 IST. Landfall started at 0800 hrs IST. Part of eye lies over land at 0830. Entire process of eye entering into land will be completed in next 2 hrs. pic.twitter.com/2RrDpvyOuj

— India Met. Dept. (@Indiametdept) May 3, 2019

details.title: Storm makes landfall near Puri
details.content: The landfall process of extremely severe Cyclone Fani began nearly at 8 am Friday close to Puri in Odisha, with the area recording a wind speed of 145 kilometres per hour, the IMD said.

details.title: WATCH: Extremely severe cyclonic storm Fani hits Odisha's Puri
details.content:
#WATCH #CycloneFani hits Puri in Odisha. pic.twitter.com/X0HlYrS0rf

— ANI (@ANI) May 3, 2019

details.title: Emergency helpline numbers
Current wind speed is 175-185 kmph
details.content: Current wind speed of cyclone as the landfall process is in progress is 175-185 kmph gusting to 195 kmph. Puri reported maxmimum sustained wind speed of 142 kmph gusting to 174 kmph, says IMD

details.title: Cyclone Fani makes landfall near Odisha's Puri, follow updates here
details.content:
⚡️ #CycloneFani makes landfall near Puri, winds speed now at about 175 km/h.#Odishahttps://t.co/OsgIZSnIvs

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) May 3, 2019

details.title: NDRF relief works underway in Andhra's Srikakulam
Here's live satellite image of cyclone Fani which hit the Odisha coast near Puri
details.content:
#CycloneFani live satellite image.#CycloneAlert #Cyclonefaniupdate #Cyclones #Weathertweet #Weatheralert #WeatherLive #satelliteimage #CycloneAlert #WeatherUpdate pic.twitter.com/IuHHr2d9RO

— SkymetWeather (@SkymetWeather) May 3, 2019

details.title: Prices of commodities spike as potato and onion vanish from shelves
details.content: According to market sources, potato, which was being sold at Rs 12-a-kg few days back, is now charged Rs 22 to Rs 30 per kg while onion vanished from the retail shops in the periphery areas of the Capital. (READ MORE)

details.title: Eye of Cyclone Fani moves into land by 10 AM
details.content: The Met department says that the eye of severe cyclonic storm Fani has completely moved into land by 10 AM and thus the cyclone has crossed the Odisha coast between 8-10 AM.

details.title: MHA helpline number for Cyclone Fani
details.content:
#CycloneFani MHA Helpline Number - 1938 pic.twitter.com/bxPAU1dIlu

— NDMA India (@ndmaindia) May 3, 2019

details.title: Babies born at Bhadrak nearly 200 km away from Cyclone Fani's ground zero
details.content:
As #CycloneFANI makes its landfall on Puri coast, babies born at Bhadrak hospital, nearly 200 km away. The cyclone is now moving towards West Bengal over Bhadrak and Balasore coast. #FaniCyclone #Odisha #CyclonicStormFANI #OdishaPrepared4Fani @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/5PMF7T5LVQ

— Hemant Kumar Rout (@Hemant_TNIE) May 3, 2019

details.title: Extremely severe cyclonic storm likely to weaken in next 6 hours
details.content: Indian Met department says the extremely severe cyclonic storm Fani is likely to move North-Northeastwards, weaken gradually and emerge into Gangetic West Bengal as a severe cyclonic storm in next 6 hours and move to Bangladesh .

details.title: Heavy rainfal and strong winds hit Ganjam as Cylone Fani hits Puri coast
details.content:
Odisha: Heavy rainfall and strong winds hit Ganjam as #FANI cyclone hits Puri coast with wind speed of above 175km/per hour. pic.twitter.com/30jdhND8L7

— ANI (@ANI) May 3, 2019

details.title: Trees uprooted as Cyclone Fani hits Odisha coast
Over 11 lakh people evacuated in Odisha
details.content:
#CycloneFani Over 11 lakh people evacuated in #Odisha, another 10 trains cancelled by East Coast railway today. (AIR)#OdishaPrepared4Fani

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) May 3, 2019

details.title: Free kitchens to come up at cyclone shelters soon
details.content: Arrangements have been made to start free kitchens at the cyclone shelters. Around 4,000 such shelters, including 880 specially designed cyclone centres, are housing the evacuees. Over one lakh dry food packets have been kept ready for air dropping for which two choppers requisitioned, Special Relief Commissioner (SRC) BP Sethi said.

details.title: High winds sweep across coastal districts of Ganjam, Khurda and Gajapati
details.content:
#Odisha: Several trees uprooted in #Bhubaneswar as strong winds hit the region under the influence of #CycloneFani. pic.twitter.com/JXtmoCw1Ad

— ANI (@ANI) May 3, 2019

details.title: Indian Navy to assess impact and devastation post Cyclone Fani in afternoon
details.content: Indian Navy's P-8I and Dornier are being scheduled to be launched in the afternoon for undertaking aerial survey to assess the extent of impact and devastation post FANI crossing the coast.

details.title: WATCH | Cyclone Fani unleashes fury as it makes landfall
FULL REPORT: Packing furious winds, heavy rains, Cyclone Fani batters Odisha coast
details.content: Packing heavy rain and winds with speeds of up to 175 kmph, cyclonic storm 'Fani' slammed into the Odisha coast Friday morning, uprooting trees and sweeping away thatched huts, as large areas of the seaside pilgrim town of Puri were left submerged. The extremely severe cyclonic storm made landfall at around 8 a.m. in Puri but thanks to enough advance warning, about 11 lakh people had already been evacuated from vulnerable and low-lying areas of at least 11 coastal districts by Thursday. (Read full report)

details.title: IMD issues de-warning for Andhra Pradesh
details.content: Cyclone Fani has moved away from Andhra Pradesh and so a de-warning has issued for the state, says IMD Delhi's Mrityunjay Mohapatra. Three districts in Andhra have been impacted by the extremely severe cyclonic storm.

details.title: Kolkata airport shuts down till Saturday morning
details.content: No flight to & from Kolkata Airport from 3 pm today to 8 am on Saturday, says Airports Authority of India. Closure timing revised from earlier announced 9.30 pm today to 6 pm tomorrow.

details.title: Police personnel involved in relief operations in Odisha
details.content:
Odisha: Police personnel of Nayapalli police station clear roads in Bhubaneswar. Several trees have been uprooted in the heavy rain and strong winds which hit the region today. #CyclonicStormFANI pic.twitter.com/tGxBvzP36c

— ANI (@ANI) May 3, 2019

details.title: Mamata Banerjee cancels rallies for next 2 days to monitor situation
details.content:
West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Friday took to Twitter to inform that she has cancelled all her election rallies for the next two days in the wake of 'impending' Cyclone Fani in her home state. (Read more)

Have cancelled my rallies for the next 48 hours because of what could be an impending disaster #CyclonicStormFANI We are monitoring the situation 24x7 and doing all it takes. I appeal to all people to cooperate. Be alert, take care and stay safe for the next two days

— Mamata Banerjee (@MamataOfficial) May 3, 2019

details.title: Fani weakens to very severe cyclonic storm
details.content: Extremely severe cyclonic storm Fani which battered the coasts of Odisha and made landfall near Puri has weakened to a very severe cyclonic storm at 11.30 AM. It is expected to move North-Northeast and weaken into a severe cyclonic storm.

details.title: NDRF involved in relief operations in Odisha
details.content:
Cyclone Fani Ground Reports : Orissa, Balasore.#TEAMNDRFINDIA #StaySafe #stayalert #stayprepared@satyaprad1 @ndmaindia @PIBHomeAffairs pic.twitter.com/p0ptql43Jc

— NDRF (@NDRFHQ) May 3, 2019

details.title: WATCH | Bhubaneswar faces Fani wrath
Damage caused by Cyclone Fani in Odisha's Bhubaneswar
AIIMS Bhubaneswar faces Fani fury
details.content:
Extensive damage to structure of AIIMS-Bhubaneswar as #CycloneFani crosses the Odisha capital. All patients, staff & students are safe. Water tanks blown off, light poles down & ACs damaged. #Odisha #CyclonicStormFANI #CycloneFaniUpdates #OdishaPrepared4Fani @NewIndianXpress

— Hemant Kumar Rout (@Hemant_TNIE) May 3, 2019

details.title: Two persons reportedly dead in Odisha
details.content: According to AFP, two persons have died in Odisha as cyclone Fani unleashes its fury. “I can confirm two deaths for now. One old man in one of the shelters died because of (a) heart attack. Another person went out in the storm despite our warnings and died because a tree fell on him,” Odisha state special relief commissioner Bishnupada Sethi told AFP.

details.title: Fani spares coastal Andhra
details.content: People in Srikakulam district and other two north coastal districts - Visakhapatnam and Vizianagaram - breathed a sigh of relief, with extreme severe cyclonic storm Fani sparing them and moving towards Odisha southern coast. [READ FULL REPORT]

details.title: Trains along Odisha coastline cancelled till Saturday
details.content: As a precaution against cyclone 'Fani', the Indian Railway has cancelled 223 trains in the Bhadrak-Vizianagaram section, along the coastal lines of Odisha on the Kolkata-Chennai route till May 4. [READ FULL REPORT]

details.title: Kolkata airport closure time revised
details.content: The Centre on Friday revised the closure time for the Kolkata airport due to extremely severe cyclonic storm Fani, which made landfall earlier in the day in neighbouring Odisha. [READ FULL REPORT]

details.title: Bhubaneswar welcomes Baby 'Fani'
details.content:
Bhubaneswar: A 32-year-old woman gave birth to a baby girl in Railway Hospital today at 11:03 AM. Baby has been named after the cyclonic storm, Fani. The woman is a railway employee, working as a helper at Coach Repair Workshop, Mancheswar. Both the mother&child are fine. #Odisha pic.twitter.com/xHGTkFPlAe

— ANI (@ANI) May 3, 2019

details.title: We're fully prepared to tackle cyclone Fani: Mamata Banerjee
details.content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Friday said the state was prepared to combat the extremely severe cyclonic storm Fani that is likely to affect six southern districts, while urging people to stay alert and not to panic. [READ FULL REPORT]

details.title: Three killed as Cyclone Fani batters Odisha
details.content: A teenager was killed when a tree came crashing down on him at a place within Sakhigopal police station area limits in Puri district. [READ FULL REPORT]

details.title: Cyclone Fani hits IIT-Bhubaneswar
details.content:
#CycloneFani shatters Hall of Residence gate of IIT-Bhubaneswar. (Video Courtesy: @ultimateaps) #Odisha #CycloneFaniUpdates #OdishaPrepared4Fani #Fani #CyclonicStormFANI @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/3QweY2Axsn

— Hemant Kumar Rout (@Hemant_TNIE) May 3, 2019

details.title: Naval warships track Cyclone Fani
details.content: Three Indian navy's warships -- Sahyadri, Ranvir and Kadmatt -- with relief material and medical teams are tracking extremely severe cyclone Fani and will be the first responder and start rescue work as soon the storm hits the coast in Odisha. [READ FULL REPORT]

A crane in Z1 falling on a near by building in Bhubaneswar.#CycloneFani pic.twitter.com/FeaRYJnEmH

— Satyopriyo Dash (@satyopriyodash) May 3, 2019

details.title: Over Rs 1000 crore released for Fani-hit states: PM
details.content: Addressing an election rally in Rajasthan, PM Narendra Modi on Friday said that over Rs 1000 crore had been released in advance for states affected by Cyclone Fani. A detailed review meeting was held and he had been given the latest updates on Cyclone Fani, Modi said as the extremely severe cyclonic storm hit Odisha on Friday morning. [READ FULL REPORT HERE]

details.title: Rain lashes Bengal
details.content: Heavy rainfall lashed Kolkata and Gangetic West Bengal on Friday. The extremely severe cyclonic storm made landfall alittle after 10 a.m. It was located over 400 km southwest of Kolkata and over 350 km, southwest of the East Midnapore district sea resort Digha. [READ FULL REPORT]

details.title: Indian Coast Guard swings into action
details.content:
@IndiaCoastGuard Ship at Sea off #Odisha Coast embarks #Relief material and food packets/drinking water onboard #CoastGuard #Helicopter to be ferried to #Gopalpur for #SevereCycloneFani affected people @DefenceMinIndia @SpokespersonMoD @PMOIndia @PIB_India pic.twitter.com/2FI1YDBImO

— Indian Coast Guard (@IndiaCoastGuard) May 3, 2019

Here's a picture of #CycloneFani's effects on a petroleum bunk in #Odisha.
LIVE: https://t.co/qTG0WyM2Qj pic.twitter.com/vIUdfgw3Tf

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) May 3, 2019
AIIMS cancels Bhubaneswar centre for Sunday exam

details.title: Cyclone weakens,  heavy rain predicted
details.content: The eye of cyclonic storm 'Fani' has "completely moved into land" by 10 am Friday weakening its fury, but heavy rainfall is still predicted in Odisha, Andhra Pradesh, West Bengal and parts of the northeastern states, the Home Ministry. [READ FULL REPORT]

details.title: Civil Aviation Minister Suresh Prabhu directs Civil Aviation Secretary to continuously monitor situation
details.content:
Directed Secreatry @MoCA to continuously monitor the situation. DGCA will be issuing revised advisories to Airlines as and when necessary. Taking all possible steps for passenger safety and to minimise their inconvenience. #CycloneFaniUpdates #CycloneFani

— Chowkidar Suresh Prabhu (@sureshpprabhu) May 3, 2019

details.title: Nepal to face Fani fury
details.content: Cyclone Fani will alter the weather conditions in Nepal and bring heavy rainfall and snowfall in the Himalayas, meteorologists warned on Friday. [READ FULL STORY]

Tropical cyclone Fani will not have a major impact on Sri Lanka in the coming days, Sri Lanka's Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said here on Friday.

The powerful cyclone slammed into India's eastern coastline on Friday, bringing torrential rain and winds of up to 200 km/h. It is one of the most severe storms to hit the region in recent years.

Assistant Director of DMC Pradeep Kodippili said that cyclone Fani was expected to increase wind speeds up to 200 km per hour and although there was no major threat to Sri Lanka, officials were deployed in several districts in case of an emergency, reported IANS.
